The Elder Pulinuppadaka’s Birth Story
“On the Himalayas,
there was an ascetic named Devala;
There was a walkway there,
honoured by non-humans.
I was full of matted hair,
always carrying a water pot;
Seeking the highest meaning,
I left the forest at that time.
Eighty-four thousand,
my disciples attended on me;
Devoted to their own duties,
they lived in the forest at that time.
Leaving the hermitage,
I made a shrine of mud;
Gathering various flowers,
I worshipped that shrine.
Having delighted my mind there,
I entered the hermitage;
All the disciples gathered together
and asked me this matter.
‘The shrine made of mud,
which you, god, worship;
We also wish to know,
when asked, please explain to us.’
‘Have they been shown in the meeting hall,
the ones with eyes, of great fame?
I worship them,
the best Buddhas, of great fame.
What are your great heroes like,
the Omniscient Ones, the Leaders of the World?
What are their complexions like, what are their virtues like,
what are your great glorious ones like?
The Buddhas have thirty-two marks,
and forty teeth as well;
Their eyes are like the eyes of a bull or a partridge,
and their lips are like the Biṃba fruit.
When the Buddhas walk,
they look a plough’s length ahead;
Their knees do not make a sound,
and the sound of their joints is not heard.

translated: When the Buddhas walk,🔽they walk as if they are raising themselves up;

The Buddhas are fearless,

They do not advertise themselves,
nor do they despise living beings.
Free from pride and conceit,

The Buddhas do not praise themselves—
this is the nature of the Buddhas.
When the Fully Enlightened Ones arise,
they show light;
They make the earth tremble,
this entire earth.
They see the hells,
and then the hells disappear;
The great rain cloud pours down,
this is the nature of the Buddhas.
Such are those great Nāgas,
incomparable and of great glory;
in beauty they are unsurpassed,

In the remaining aeons,

I do not know of a bad destination,

the vehicle for the attainment of safety,
like an elephant who has broken his bonds,
I live without defilements.
